data.event: In the 2005 INEGI Census, the city reported a total population of 21113.

event.title: the future state of Veracruz was brought

data.event: This part of the future state of Veracruz was brought under Aztec sway in or around 1450 under Emperor Moctezuma Ilhuicamina.

event.title: 1627, Rodrigo de Vivero y Aberrucia, owner of the sugar mill at the time, was named

data.event: In 1627, Rodrigo de Vivero y Aberrucia, owner of the sugar mill at the time, was named the First Count of the Valley of Orizaba by Philip III of Spain.

event.title: 27 October 1812, during the War of Independence, the sugar mill was taken

data.event: On 27 October 1812, during the War of Independence, the sugar mill was taken by surprise by General José María Morelos, who used it as a staging post for his attack on the royalist forces in Orizaba the next day.

event.title: his attack on the royalist forces in Orizaba the next day

data.event: On 27 October 1812, during the War of Independence, the sugar mill was taken by surprise by General José María Morelos, who used it as a staging post for his attack on the royalist forces in Orizaba the next day.
